@description.name: @description
@description.body: A formatter and parser for numbers. NOTE: Instances of this class must be disposed of after use

@param.name: @param
@param.body: locale {String} optional locale to be used

@throws.name: @throws
@throws.body: {Error} If the argument is not a string.
@throws.description: If the argument is not a string.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: The minimum number of integer digits (digits before the decimal separator). Missing digits will be filled up with 0 ("19" -> "0019").

@description.name: @description
@description.body: The maximum number of integer digits (superfluous digits will be cut off ("1923" -> "23").

@description.name: @description
@description.body: The minimum number of fraction digits (digits after the decimal separator). Missing digits will be filled up with 0 ("1.5" -> "1.500")

@description.name: @description
@description.body: The maximum number of fraction digits (digits after the decimal separator). Superfluous digits will cause rounding ("1.8277" -> "1.83")

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Whether thousand groupings should be used {e.g. "1,432,234.65"}.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: The prefix to put before the number {"EUR " -> "EUR 12.31"}.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Sets the postfix to put after the number {" %" -> "56.13 %"}.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Locale used

@description.name: @description
@description.body: The owning object

@description.name: @description
@description.body: {String} The ID of the object.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Formats a number.

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {String} the formatted number as a string.
@return.description: the formatted number as a string.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Parses a number.

@throws.name: @throws
@throws.body: {Error} If the number string does not match the number format.
@throws.description: If the number string does not match the number format.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Gets the (computed) value of the property qxOwner. For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #qxOwner}.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Sets the user value of the property qxOwner. For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #qxOwner}.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Resets the user value of the property qxOwner. The computed value falls back to the next available value e.g. appearance, init or inheritance value depending on the property configuration and value availability. For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #qxOwner}.
